sentence.idiomatic: He has a high tolerance for alcohol--even after a thousand drinks he's still not drunk.
He said he can hold his liquor, but he was out of it after having only two glasses.
Lately I've got a lot of social engagements. I need to learn how to drink so that I drink a lot without getting drunk.

word.literal: to be hard to come by

sentence.idiomatic: It's not often everyone is this happy. Tonight we won't go home sober.
He's an alcoholic. He goes home drunk every night.
Today let's agree that we won't go home sober. Everyone drink as much as they please.
Doctor, is his disease curable?
The bank has agreed to give us a loan. Our company is saved.
As long as everyone makes a united effort to protect the environment, our earth can be saved.
Their company claims that their product is the best buy for the money.
You had better be careful if you're going to fight with him. He is known as the strongest person in our class.
Last week I went to the place known as 'heaven on earth', Hangzhou. Sure enough, the scenery was very beautiful.
He can really drink. He can drink three bottles of rice wine all in one go.
Can your alcohol tolerance compare with his? He is known as the one thousand drink drunkard.
A staff member from the PR department wants to take the clients out to drink. If he can't hold his alcohol, then no way.
Your mistake this time cost the company far more than a few million in losses.
If you compare his reputation with yours, there's not just a slight difference--there's simply a huge disparity.
It was far more than just one or two households that were cheated by him. The majority of the people in our village got cheated by him.
His capacity for alcohol was inherited from his father.
Is obesity passed on to one's children?
You inherited all of your father's laziness, but none of his intelligence.

word.literal: to get drunk and act crazy

sentence.idiomatic: As soon as he gets drunk he starts to act crazy, throwing any object he sees.

word.literal: to get drunk and act crazy

sentence.idiomatic: Don't pay any attention to him, he's drunk and out of it. Everything he's saying is wild talk.

word.literal: to get drunk and act crazy

sentence.idiomatic: Yesterday evening he was dead drunk. Even after he got home he was acting crazy, singing all night long.
It's over. The regional manager is coming.
What, is he bad-tempered?
No, he's good to the employees.
So what are you worried about?

It's because he's too good that I'm worried. He loves taking us out for dinner and drinks. But he's such a good drinker! He simply does not get drunk, even after like a thousand drinks. Plus he insists on the employees drinking with him. We never go home sober.
Awesome! That's the boss of my dreams! I can drink for free.
Huh? Just looking at you, I'd never guess you were a superwoman. So this time we're saved!
Relax! Just leave the drinking duties to me. Hey, what alcohol does the boss like to drink?
He drinks everything. White rice wine, yellow rice wine, western alcohol... if it's booze, he drinks it.
Oh no, I can't drink western alcohol. It's OK, I'll toast him with white rice wine.

Can you really drink? There are a few in the company that claim to be good drinkers, but they were all no match. Last year at a company dinner he had a drink-off with everybody. In the end not a single person remembered how they got home.
He bested your entire table all by himself?
Way more than one table. It was the whole company!
I'm a decent drinker. In college, no boy could out-drink me.
You can drink like that naturally?

Yeah, I get it from my mom. Before, I didn't even know I could drink. One time some classmates got together and I drank several bottles of beer with no problem. Then I drank some white rice wine, and didn't feel a thing.
So did you put this drinking ability of yours on your resume? That would be why our HR department snatched you up.
Such a joker. By the way, does this manager get crazy when he drinks?
Yeah. But don't be afraid. He won't act sleazy. I hear that when he gets drunk he just sings opera.
Really? Sounds fun. I can't wait to have a few drinks with him.

word.literal: to get drunk and act crazy
